result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Edward Rury was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances unless prescribed and to be taken only as prescribed.
Defendant shall submit to random, observed testing for controlled substances on request of DOC agent, law enforcement, or designee.
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as indicated by DOC.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Edward Rury

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Donald Edward Rury in court.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Donald Edward Rury.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant to plead to Count 1 with 1 year probation, $200 plus costs, counseling, DNA, drug testing. Count 2 would be dismissed as read-in. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 dismissed as read-in. State heard. Attorney Sauder heard. Defendant heard. Court orders probation one year with conditions: not to possess or consume controlled substances unless prescribed, random observed testing for controlled substances on request of agent or officer, counseling, DNA, $200 plus costs to Clerk of Court. No credit.

Defendant Donald Edward Rury in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Donald Edward Rury. Court reviews preliminary hearing and waiver document with defendant. Court finds defendant knowingly and freely waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court binds matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to charges. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Donald Edward Rury in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Donald Edward Rury. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Attorney Sauder has been retained. State requests a signature bond. Court heard and orders $500 signature bond. Preliminary hearing set.
Initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
